criterion: Provides a clear and concise SOAP note based on the given information
Incorrectly states that topiramate is a treatment for tension headaches
Asks the user for more information about their headaches before creating a SOAP note
Uses technical medical jargon or overly complex language
Includes red flag symptoms that should prompt medical assessment, such as severe headaches, vomiting, or difficulty speaking
Mentions that the patient will be seen in three months without explicitly stating the purpose of the follow-up
Incorrectly assumes the patient has a sedentary job based on the provided information
Includes a clear and concise summary of the patient's medical history
Fails to include the patient's age in the SOAP note
Uses a natural and clear tone when describing the patient's symptoms
Incorrectly states that the patient has no significant past medical issues
